FacilityName: Rockbridge Farmer's Coop., Inc. - LP Gas
DeregistrationReasonOtherText: The facility is no longer covered covered by the RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN 40 CFR

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Certification Statement
To the best of the undersigneds knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.


____________________________        _________________________________
Signature                                             Print Name

____________________________        ______________________
Title                                                       Date

Executive Summary

Rockbridge Farmers Coop complies with NFPA  58 requirements, as well as our own safety program concerning the storage of  LP gas.  It is our policy to adhere with all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  In the event of an emergency,, our policy is to notify the Lexington Fire Department and request them to respond to the emergency.
The facility is a retail propane facility.  Propane is stored in a 30,000 gallon propane tank.  The propane is delivered from this tank to our customers via propane delivery trucks.  There is a transport un-load rack in addition to a load rack for delivery vehicles.  Bumper posts are located at both racks to protect from vehicle impact.  Automatic shut-off valves are located at transfer piping hook-up areas to mitigate releases caused by a pull away incident. 
The worst-case scenario is the failure of our 30,000 gallon tank when filled to maximum capacity (85% at 60F), resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  According  to look-up tables, the distance to 1 psi endpoint is .4 miles.  The residential population, according to census data, is 31 people within the 1 psi endpoint.  There are 12 commercial areas within the 1 psi endpoint.
The facility complies with EPAs accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The propane system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA  58 and state law.
Rockbridge Farmers Coop has never had an accident involving propane that caused death, injury, property or environmental damage, or evacuati

ons.
In the event of an emergency involving our LP tank and system, it is our policy to notify the Lexington Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.
Rockbridge Farmers Coop plans to implement any change to its safety program that will improve the safety of the facility.
